alert.note: Alert for Harlan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 1:22AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Phillips and southern Harlan Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 122 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Woodruff to near Phillipsburg. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alma, Orleans, Republican City, Woodruff and Harlan County Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
